chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b : Z, a <> 1 -> a <> -1 -> b <> 0 -> ~ (Z.mul a b | b)

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Zdivide_bounds : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> b <> 0 -> Z.abs a <= Z.abs b
Z.mod_divide : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a mod b = 0 < -> (b | a)
sqr_lt : forall a : Z, a <> 0 -> a <> 1 -> a < a * a
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
QArith_base.Qinv_lt_contravar : forall a b : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} a -> QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} b -> QArith_base.Qlt a b < -> QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qinv b) (QArith_base.Qinv a)
Zdivide_opp_l : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> (- a | b)
Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a b : Z, (- a | b) -> (a | b)
prime_mult : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a b : Z, (p | a * b) -> (p | a) \/ (p | b)
rel_prime_bezout : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> Bezout a b 1
Gauss : forall a b c : Z, (a | b * c) -> rel_prime a b -> (a | c)
QArith_base.Qlt_shift_div_l : forall a b c : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} c -> QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qmult a c) b -> QArith_base.Qlt a (QArith_base.Qdiv b c)
QArith_base.Qle_shift_div_l : forall a b c : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} c -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult a c) b -> QArith_base.Qle a (QArith_base.Qdiv b c)
Z.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | b)
BinIntDef.Z.gcd = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs b | Z.pos a0 | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs a | Z.pos b0 | Z.neg b0 => Z.pos (Pos.gcd a0 b0) end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.gcd (_ _)%Z_scope
Bezout_ind : forall (a b d : Z) (P : Prop), (forall u v : Z, u * a + v * b = d -> P) -> Bezout a b d -> P
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
prime_divisors : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, (a | p) -> a = -1 \/ a = 1 \/ a = p \/ a = - p
Z.gcd_nonneg : forall a b : Z, 0 <= Z.gcd a b
Z.Bezout = fun n m p : Z => exists a b : Z, a * n + b * m = p : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.Bezout (_ _ _)%Z_scope
Z.gcd_divide_l : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | a)
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_rel_prime : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, ~ (p | a) -> rel_prime p a
BinIntDef.Z.quotrem = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0 => (0, 0) | Z.pos a0 => match b with | 0 => (0, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | Z.neg b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (- BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) end | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0 => (0, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (- BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, - BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | Z.neg b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0...
Zdivide_dec : forall a b : Z, {(a | b)} + {~ (a | b)}

```coq
intros a b H1 H2 H3.
intro H4.
apply Zdivide_bounds in H4.
rewrite Z.mod_divide in H4.
destruct H4 as [H4 _].
apply Zdivide_opp_l in H4.
apply Zdivide_opp_l_rev in H4.
apply prime_mult with (p := a) in H4.
destruct H4 as [H5 | H5].
+ apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H5.
  destruct H5 as [x [y H5]].
  rewrite H5 in H4.
  simpl in H4.
  apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
  destruct H4.
  - apply Zdivide_bounds in H4.
    rewrite Z.mod_divide in H4.
    destruct H4 as [H4 _].
    apply Zdivide_opp_l in H4.
    apply Zdivide_opp_l_rev in H4.
    apply prime_mult with (p := a) in H4.
    destruct H4 as [H6 | H6].
    * apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H6.
      destruct H6 as [x [y H6]].
      rewrite H6 in H4.
      simpl in H4.
      apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
      destruct H4.
      contradiction.
    * apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H6.
      destruct H6 as [x [y H6]].
      rewrite H6 in H4.
      simpl in H4.
      apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
      destruct H4.
      contradiction.
  - contradiction.
+ apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H5.
  destruct H5 as [x [y H5]].
  rewrite H5 in H4.
  simpl in H4.
  apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
  destruct H4.
  - apply Zdivide_bounds in H4.
    rewrite Z.mod_divide in H4.
    destruct H4 as [H4 _].
    apply Zdivide_opp_l in H4.
    apply Zdivide_opp_l_rev in H4.
    apply prime_mult with (p := a) in H4.
    destruct H4 as [H6 | H6].
    * apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H6.
      destruct H6 as [x [y H6]].
      rewrite H6 in H4.
      simpl in H4.
      apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
      destruct H4.
      contradiction.
    * apply rel_prime_bezout with (a := a) (b := b) in H6.
      destruct H6 as [x [y H6]].
      rewrite H6 in H4.
      simpl in H4.
      apply Zdivide_dec in H4.
      destruct H4.
      contradiction.
  - contradiction.
Qed.
